status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: UHMW DNA Extraction - Monarch Kit Direct Lysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1quqn","text":"A DNA extraction protocol that yields clean and homogeneous UHMW DNA is essential for a good ultra-long (UL) sequencing output. We have routinely used the New England Biolabs (NEB) Monarch HMW DNA Extraction Kit for Cells \u0026 Blood (T3050) for UL library preparations, with the following modifications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":155,"length":83}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2s8r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b8u6","text":"*This protocol has been optimised in human cell lines.*","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7h8r","text":"Two nucleic acid quantification methods, i.e., fluorometric (Qubit) and spectrophotometric (Nanodrop), can be used in parallel to assess both the quantity and quality of the extracted DNA. The quantification follows the published protocol by Koetsier and Cantor with slight modifications as follows.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":41,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":242,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"1pfhh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a37nv","text":"An accurate measurement of DNA concentration is important as this will determine the optimum ratio of transposase (FRA) to DNA molecules at the library prep step. Also, the viscous nature of UHMW DNA requires that sample measurement represents all parts of the DNA solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hi03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9744","text":"A total of    DNA is sampled from three different points of the solution: top, middle, and bottom part. Combine in a 2 ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4aflj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8dpbr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evra1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"06BD94510B2411EC802D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34232102/"}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aouns","text":"Use a cut P10 tip to aspirate DNA sample and if the sample is too viscous, cut the DNA thread by pushing the tip against the bottom of the tube. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bsr9s","text":"When available, a positive displacement pipette can also be used to ensure more accurate liquid aspiration.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

If RNA content is more than 100% than DNA, DNA quantification needs to be adjusted for library input, i.e. adding more DNA, or repeat RNaseA and glass bead precipitation. RNA quantification step is especially helpful if isolating DNA from a certain cell type for the first time.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
